content.description: Sit start in front of the small tree. Left hand in the excellent slot, right hand on the small rail. Move straight up through one good crimp and then one not great micro crimp before the good ledge. Chunky flakes and ledges to the right are off.*** If this is already an established problem please let me know. ***
content.location: Route is around the SW side of Samurai Sword boulder. Route starts in front of a small tree, to the left of Skeletrex. About a foot or so above the start holds is a near perfect X scar in the rock.

content.description:
Beautiful arête, turned dihedral problem. stand start, hands crossed (left on a small crimp rail and right on a sloping feature below). struggle to get established on a high left foot and right foot in a dish, fire up to a decent crimp, and work a few layback moves til you can gain a kneebar in the dihedral. work hands left, unwind from the kneebar, and cruise the easy layback jugs to a slightly spicy top.   

  last few moves are still cleaning up. they are easy, just be careful.
content.location: Magic School Bus Boulder, facing downhill. chalk on the corner to corner feature.

content.description: Best sloper problem of the grade in AR! start on the low divot on the right arête and work your way up the perfect slopers, using the face for feet or your heel on the arête. so fun.
content.location: in between a few huge boulders just uphill from Alabama 2 and the quarry.

content.description: From fat slopers to two finger pockets, this problem has the works.  start on a good hold in the wide crack and work left through good holds and movement. get established past the overhang and make a big move to a shared hold with Alabama 2, then top out via Alabama 2.
content.protection: though the moves aren't too high off the ground, the landing is very uneven and jagged, forming a little hole almost (thus the name). 3 pads and a spotter preferable.
content.location: downhill but on the same boulder as Alabama 2, uphill and south of hurricane handouts, downhill and south of bottom feeders.

content.description: right side of the boulder, to the right of bottom feeders

climbs.name: must be this tall to climb

content.description: Weird problem. start sitting under the block with ok holds, make either a super powerful move out to the arête and avoid the dab, or if you are tall enough there is a secret toe hook.  then slap up the friction dependent slopers to topout
content.location: same boulder as bottom feeders, but on the downhill side

content.description: Really obvious problem on the left side of the overhang. not to be missed.start on small, sharp or slopey crimps (choose your poison on the obvious rail), bust a powerful move out left and work through the power sequence into a slopey sequence at the top. fight the pump on the spicey finish.

Hard to grade. start on the left side of the boulder, mover through a fun series of giant huecos as far right as you can and head up to a nails hard sloper top-out.  getting through the huecos is probably v3, but the moves to gain the top, then actually topping out is difficult. the hueco section is easier if you use the lip while transitioning between huecos but is not necessary. also a problem that rides the lip the whole way.
content.location: downhill from bottom feeders, around corner from hurricane handouts, facing highball warmup

content.description: problem left of Violent Nature. sit start with left hand on a crimp and right hand undercling. work moves up obvious holds until you have to find a way to stab the left hand into the eye shaped pocket. big move out right then ride good holds to the finish.

Stand start with your left hand on the left sloping  jug rail, right hand on a small sloping crimp . Reachy move to a decent pinch that’s under the left downward mini roof, top out through the Skull looking feature up and to the right.
content.location: SW facing boulder behind and around the corner of Samurai Sword and Short Sword

content.description: good holds to the lip, then with the left hand on a good undercling, slap your way up to the highest sloper and top out.
content.location: to the left of hard to gouge on the magic school bus boulder.

content.description: start on a jutting block on the left side of the boulder. do compression moves up slopes and slaps to a few crimps and finish. top out on left side
content.location: one of the first boulders you see on the south side area

content.description: beautiful highball problem. stand start in the middle and work up whatever you feel like to topout at the highest point.
content.location: downhill from bottom feeders, around corner from hurricane handouts and facing hueco problem.

content.description:
start in some sloping slots on the right side of the lazy boulder. make a stabbing first move, then work through a cool sequence of crimps and sidepulls. top out is easy.  the rock looks fragile but is bomber.   

WARNING* while getting on top of the boulder is easy, once you topout there is about 30 ft of leaf-dirt-vine slab that I would not recommend. I want to fix a rope in the future, but until then I might recommend dropping off.
content.location: uphill and to the south of hurricane handouts, downhill and to the south of bottom feeders.

content.description: Boulders on the west side of the small tributary running downhill to Hurricane Creek.
